headline: Did You Know? Truck Drivers Deserve Better
primaryText:
Commercial truck drivers are required by federal law to take mandatory 10-hour rest breaks. During these breaks, they're stuck at truck stops with limited, overpriced food options - and they can't leave their truck.

That's 3.5 million drivers across America who need a better solution.

Happy Eats is building the first complete driver lifestyle platform:

üöõ Food & parts delivered directly to your truck stop
‚è±Ô∏è HOS-compliant break timer
üìç GPS finder: gas, showers, scales, hotels, gyms
üí¨ Trucker Talk - connect with other drivers
üìä Mileage & expense tracking for tax season
üéÆ Games & entertainment during rest periods

Coming Spring 2026. Join the waitlist at happyeats.app

headline: Gig Workers: Stop Losing Money on Taxes
primaryText:
If you drive for work - Uber, DoorDash, Instacart, or just commuting - you're leaving money on the table.

The IRS allows $0.70 per mile deduction in 2026. Most drivers forget to track their miles and miss out on thousands in deductions.

Happy Eats isn't just food delivery. It's your complete driver business suite:

üì± Automatic GPS mileage tracking
üí∞ IRS deduction calculator
üßæ Receipt OCR scanning
üìÅ Expense categorization (fuel, parking, tolls, meals)
üì§ CSV export for TurboTax & H&R Block

Track miles. Save on taxes. All in one app.

Coming Spring 2026. Get early access at happyeats.app

headline: Coming to Our Community: Happy Eats
primaryText:
Neighbors - exciting news for our local economy!

Happy Eats is launching Spring 2026 in the Nashville area, including Lebanon and Mt. Juliet.

What is it? A platform connecting local food vendors with truck drivers at nearby rest stops.

Why it matters:
‚Ä¢ Supports local restaurants and food trucks
‚Ä¢ Creates delivery driver jobs
‚Ä¢ Brings new customers to our community
‚Ä¢ Keeps food dollars local
